John Lee Ratcliffe (born October 20, 1965) is an American politician and attorney. He is the 6th Director of National Intelligence since 2020. He was the congressman for Texas's 4th district from 2015 to 2020.
He was one of the most conservative congressmen during his congressional career.
President Donald Trump announced on July 28, 2019, that he intended to nominate Ratcliffe to replace Dan Coats as Director of National Intelligence (DNI). Ratcliffe withdrew his name five days after some senators raised concerns about his experience.
On February 28, 2020, President Trump announced that he was nominating Ratcliffe to be Director of National Intelligence. Ratcliffe was confirmed by the Senate on May 21, 2020 by a vote of 49 to 44.
